body_html:
I didn't had much chance to debug the original issue with gcc 6.4 but I debugged gcc 5.4 and the reason of the failure is that there is apparently a bug in Ubuntu 17.10 where _GLIBCXX_USE_C99 is not set in /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/c++/5/bits/c++config.h in package libstdc++-5-dev. This leads to the issue with gcc 5.4. This is the bug in launchpad https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gcc-5/+bug/1725848 and it is in status "Won't Fix" as gcc 5 is considered very outdated and not supported any more. The only solution I found for now is to use gcc 4.8 which works for me:

sudo apt-get install gcc-4.8 g++-4.8
export CC=gcc-4.8
export CXX=g++-4.8

I think it would be good if we check in CMake if the gcc-5 is used under Ubuntu 17.10 and show a meaningful error similar to caffe2/caffe2#1633 which is essentially same problem under caffee2. I'll work on this.

body:
I didn't had much chance to debug the original issue with gcc 6.4 but I debugged gcc 5.4 and the reason of the failure is that there is apparently a bug in Ubuntu 17.10 where _GLIBCXX_USE_C99 is not set in /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/c++/5/bits/c++config.h in package libstdc++-5-dev. This leads to the issue with gcc 5.4. This is the bug in launchpad https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gcc-5/+bug/1725848 and it is in status "Won't Fix" as gcc 5 is considered very outdated and not supported any more. The only solution I found for now is to use gcc 4.8 which works for me:

sudo apt-get install gcc-4.8 g++-4.8
export CC=gcc-4.8
export CXX=g++-4.8

I think it would be good if we check in CMake if the gcc-5 is used under Ubuntu 17.10 and show a meaningful error similar to https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/1633 which is essentially same problem under caffee2. I'll work on this.
